name: Harbourview Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Harbourview for three nights in January and loved our visit. We had previously stayed several times at a sister hotel, French Quarter Inn, and also loved that hotel, but we just decided it was time for a change. Both hotels are wonderful, but we did enjoy the location of the Harbourview more. The lobby of the FQI, though, is much more spacious--it's quite beautiful.
reviews.title: We'll return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid for a harbor view room on a top floor and also requested to be close to the fountain. These requests, I think, ensured us a superior view. The room itself was not as large as I had thought it would be, but the furnishings were lovely, the bed fantastic, and the bathroom was quite nice. We had enough closet/storage space for our 3-night stay, but it would have been problematic for a stay of much longer. We were able to peek into a room across the hall (not a harbor view, I think), and it seemed much larger.
reviews.title: Looking forward to stay again

reviews.text: Our balcony was a definite plus--especially since it was warm enough while we were there to sit out. We went downstairs for the complimentary wine/cheese and brought them up to enjoy on our balcony. On top of that, the sunrises over the water each morning were breathtaking.
reviews.title: Service, location, comfort, and luxury

reviews.text: We had the complimentary breakfast both in the room and downstairs. The cereal is not out downstairs, but the attendants nicely provided it when asked.
reviews.title: Exceptional in every way!

reviews.text: We definitely will stay at the Harbourview during our next Charleston trip. We were more than happy with the hotel and the location.
reviews.title: Harbour haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently booked a short getaway in Charleston and tried the Harbourview Inn. We are very happy that we did. The location is very convenient to many shops and restaurants. It's an easy walk to the City Market. The Inn was immaculate and the free breakfast and afternoon wine & cheese receptions were nice perks. Some rooms have harbour views and there is a cozy rooftop terrace for the nice weather days. Best of all, the staff could not have been more helpful and congenial. There are many places to stay in Charleston but the Harbourview Inn is certainly one of the best if you prefer the more intimate feel of an Inn.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay in the heart of the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked the perfect weather week in January to visit Charleston for our 50th Wedding Anniversary. We searched the internet for 4 and 5 Star Hotels in the area. We selected Harbor View Inn. We were sold by the information and pictures on their website. Our stay at the Inn and visit to Charleston was perfect. The personnel at Harbor View Inn were friendly, courteous and very accommodating. Our room was beautiful and very comfortable. The beds were the most comfortable we have ever experienced in any of our travels. The location was great - convenient to everything, yet off the beaten path. We never moved our car, we walked everywhere. We particularly enjoyed the room service for breakfast, the afternoon cheese and wine, and the warm cookies and milk in the evenings. The Harbor View Inn is definitely our hotel of choice in Charleston.
reviews.title: 50th Wedding Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took fiance down to Charleston 2/2 - 2/4 for her birthday weekend. And while I have done a good bit of traveling, staying at a number of high end places, this experience was truly exceptional.
reviews.title: Impeccable & Memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: RESERVATION - I reached out to 4-5 of the high end places in Charleston, asking questions about each property as well as any possible upgrades associated with a birthday celebration. Harbourview responded alomost immediately with an offer of complimentaty champagne and possible room upgrade (no guarantee) based on availability. Booked a Shopping Experience package at Harbourview, which included several nice additions.
reviews.title: Please, answer the phone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ARRIVAL - Concierge/BellHop immediately greeted us curbside, notifying front desk of our arrival. While checking in, our luggage was unloaded and taken directly to our room. And imagine my surprise when I was told we had been upgraded to The Suite at Harbourview Inn at no additional cost (their nicest room, only reserved by calling Inn directly).
reviews.title: Vacation
Fantastic Inn
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Harbour View Inn for our honeymoon. We stayed in the penthouse suite and had a decent view of the harbor and the pier. The rooms were beautifully decorated. The living area had a small couch, 2 armchairs, a working gas fireplace, a writing desk with chair and a large armoire with a TV , drawers, ample closet space, iron board and iron. There was a mini fridge that was stocked when we arrived. There was also a balcony off the living area. The bedroom had another large armoire with a TV and a four post king size bed and another balcony off the bedroom. The bathroom was a pretty decent size and had a jacuzzi tub. Having breakfast served to our room every morning was great, especially when we had the option of choosing what we wanted for breakfast from their breakfast menu. It was convenient to able to go the lobby at anytime and have some sort of snack and coffee and/or tea. The Harborview Inn was within walking distance to the shops and restaurants in the historic district and also about a 15 minute walk to the Imax theater and Charleston Aquarium. The staff was very friendly. We had a wonderful time there and can't wait to go back next year for our anniversary!

We came to the Harbourview Inn to spend a couple of days in Charleston with our 2 young girls. We'd never visited Charleston before & I did a little research looking for a hotel. So glad we chose the Harborview Inn.
reviews.title: Perfect stay!

reviews.text: From the phone reservation I made directly with the hotel, to the time we checked out, the customer service was impeccable. The staff definitely went above & beyond.
reviews.title: Love the Harbourview Inn!

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed the wine & cheese each evening and took advantage of the lovely views from the rooftop terrace. Our girls got a big kick out of the "late night" fresh baked cookies in the lobby. The complimentary breakfast each morning was way more than we could've expected. The location of the hotel was amazing. It was so nice to be right across the street from the Waterfront Park. We were able to walk everywhere. We parked our car when we arrived and didn't pick it up until we checked out.
reviews.title: Charming boutique hotel with wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really can't say enough!! We had a wonderful time and my husband & I are planning to return so that we might be able to enjoy some of the historical tours that we weren't able to go on. We will definitely choose the Harborview Inn again!!
reviews.title: Our stay at the Harbourview Inn
Great location and staff
reviews.text: Loved the personalized service with complimentary breakfast in the room, wine and cheese in the afternoon and cookies and milk before bed. Tempur-Pedic beds were a treat too. Would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Great location, service and accomodations
reviews.text: We just returned from a mid-August trip to Charleston SC. We found the Harbour View Inn (after a disappointing first night at the French Quarter Inn) and it is special. The Harbour View Inn is a small hotel (50-55 rooms) located by the fountain in Waterfront Park. I'm not sure I'd recommend it for families with young children, but couples will love this hotel. While all rooms are identical (except for bed size) their prices reflect the view, with lower rates for non-water front views. You will find 4 poster beds and and very attractive, clean rooms, along with the standard wine & cheese, bedtime cookies and morning pastries. The Harbour View Inn is a wonderful boutique hotel, resonalbly priced for the value given. They have a web site. Check it out and enjoy your stay.

reviews.title: Kudos to the HarbourView Inn
reviews.text: Just returned from a three night stay in Charleston with my family. The Harbourview Inn was centrally located to shopping and restaurants. I found the staff very attentive and extremely helpful.

reviews.title: Great for Business & Pleasure
reviews.text: The room was very spacious for a family of four.

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: Looking forward to my next visit.

reviews.title: Outstanding visit!
reviews.text: Just spent 3 nights. Told them we were celebrating my wife's birthday and they had a complimentary bucket of champagne waiting for us. They had also strewn rose petals on the floor which went well with the flowers which I had the local florist deliver. We had the option of breakfast in our room, had cheese and wine in the afternoon, and freshly baked cookies in the evening.
Wonderful location.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, wonderful rooms
Great, but had issues Oct. 8-11
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here over Columbus Day weekend. Our room was great and at a fairly reasonable price considering that it was in-season. The hotel is within walking distance of everything in the historic district. They have a great custom-ordered continental breakfast that they deliver to your room and a nightly wine and cheese hour. And the staff was very friendly, helpful, and accommodating.

Great place to stay in Chas but did have some initial issues with the front desk staff. I made our reservation thru Travelocity and followed up with the hotel staff to let them know that I wanted a room with a King bed. They informed me that this
reviews.title: Excellent location
Really great place to stay in Charleston
reviews.text: would not be an issue. When we arrived we were taken to a room on the first floor, facing another building 10 feet away, that had two queen beds. I then asked Joanne at the front desk for a room with a single King bed and was informed that all room reservations not made directly thru the hotel were assigned non harborview rooms of which only four have King size beds. I asked for the managers card and returned to our assigned room. After 5 min was suprised to hear from Joanne that a KING room facing the harbour was suddenly available.

My wife stayed here for a few days 02/04/13-02/06/13 and the Inn was terrific. I will start with the room. Very spacious and extremly comfortable. If you do not know the beds are Tempurpedic and in our opinion they are the most comfortable bed you can sleep on. The Tempurpedic beds are very expensive but worth the cost I know because we own one. The rooms also come with a 47 inch TV, refrigerator,safe and bose wave radio with ipod dock. The bathroom was also large and nicely decorated. The location is great and close to everything you would want to do.The service at Harbourview Inn is nothing short of the best !!! The breakfast delivered to room was very good. Do yourself a favor and stay here when you are in Charleston. We have stayed at a lot of locations in Charleston and the Harbourview Inn was the best. My wife and I will not stay any where else but here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Harbourview Inn is a great location on the waterfront and in the heart of downtown. My husband & I walked to the battery to see the Mansions on the Waterfront, to the City Market, down King street to wonderful stores and eateries. My favorite store in Charleston is Graffito, a contemporary jewelry and gift store on East Bay Street
reviews.title: Should be No. 1 on tripadvisor!!

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and they do provide Valet service which is a plus even though the garage is attached to the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice perks, great location, a few flaws

description: Enjoy unparalleled service and signature amenities from this AAA Four-Diamond and Condé Nast "Gold List Award" luxury hotel. Panoramic views, vast atriums and beautifully appointed guest rooms - some with private balconies, working fireplaces, and whirlpool tubs - await your arrival. From the moment you enter one of the most historic hotels in Charleston, SC, you will find modern features and services, old world charm and unpretentious Southern hospitality. The waterfront and atrium lobbies are reminiscent of Charleston's early years as a colonial nautical trading hub. They offer the perfect setting for idle reflection, a glass of wine or just the refined sport of people watching.
